text: Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety

questions.text: Is your country a Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB)?
If you answered No to question 12, is there any national process in place towards becoming a Party?
Here you may provide further details
Has your country introduced the necessary legal, administrative and other measures for the implementation of the Protocol?

values.text: A domestic regulatory framework is fully in place
A domestic regulatory framework is partially in place
Only temporary measures have been introduced
No measures have yet been taken

questions.text: Which specific instruments are in place for the implementation of your national biosafety framework?

values.text: One or more national biosafety laws
One or more national biosafety regulations
One or more sets of biosafety guidelines
Other laws, regulations or guidelines that indirectly apply to biosafety

questions.text: Has your country established a mechanism for the budgetary allocations of funds for the operation of its national biosafety framework?
Does your country have permanent staff to administer functions directly related to the national biosafety framework?
If you answered Yes to question 18, how many permanent staff members are in place whose functions are directly related to the national biosafety framework?
Has your country’s biosafety framework / laws / regulations / guidelines been submitted to the Biosafety Clearing-House (BCH)?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 2 in your country:
Does your country regulate the transboundary movement, handling and use of living modified organisms (LMOs) which are pharmaceuticals?
If you answered Yes to question 22, has this information been submitted to the BCH?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 5 in your country:
Does your country regulate the transit of LMOs?
Does your country regulate the contained use of LMOs?
If you answered Yes to questions 25 or 26, has this information been submitted to the BCH?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 6 in your country:

text: Articles 7 to 10 – Advance Informed Agreement (AIA) and  intentional introduction of LMOs into the environment

questions.text: Has your country adopted law(s) / regulations / administrative measures for the operation of the AIA procedure of the Protocol?
Has your country adopted a domestic regulatory framework consistent with the Protocol regarding the transboundary movement of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
Has your country established a mechanism for taking decisions regarding first intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered Yes to question 31, does the mechanism also apply to cases of intentional introduction of LMOs into the environment that were not subject to transboundary movement?
Has your country established a mechanism for monitoring potential effects of LMOs that are released into the environment?
Does your country have the capacity to detect and identify LMOs?

Has your country established legal requirements for exporters under its jurisdiction to notify in writing the competent national authority of the Party of import prior to the intentional transboundary movement of an LMO that falls within the scope of the AIA procedure?
Has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information contained in the notification?
Has your country ever received an application / notification regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
Has your country ever taken a decision on an application / notification regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered Yes to question 38, how many LMOs has your country approved to date for import for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered Yes to question 38, how many LMOs, not imported, has your country approved to date for intentional introduction into the environment?
In the current reporting period, how many applications/notifications has your country received regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?

With reference to the decisions taken on intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment, has your country received a notification from the Party(ies) of export or from the exporter(s) prior to the transboundary movement?
Did the notifications contain complete information (at a minimum the information specified in Annex I of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety)?
Has your country acknowledged receipt of the notifications to the notifier within ninety days of receipt?
Has your country informed the notifier(s) and the BCH of its decision(s)?

values.text: In some cases only the notifier
In some cases only the BCH

questions.text: Has your country informed the notifier(s) and the BCH of its decision(s) in due time (within 270 days or the period specified in your communication to the notifier)?
What percentage of your country’s decisions fall into the following categories?

values.text: Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) without conditions
Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) with conditions
Prohibition of the import/use of the LMO(s)
Inform the notifier that the period for communicating the decision has been extended

questions.text: In cases where your country approved an import with conditions or prohibited an import, did it provide reasons on which its decisions were based to the notifier and the BCH?

values.text: In some cases only the notifier
In some cases only the BCH

questions.text: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Articles 7-10 in your country, including measures in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs for intentional introduction to the environment:

text: Article 11 – Procedure for living modified organisms  intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing (LMOs-FFP)

questions.text: Has your country adopted specific law(s) or regulation(s) for decision-making regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs-FFP?
Has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information to be provided by the applicant?
Has your country established a mechanism to ensure that decisions regarding LMOs-FFP that may be subject to transboundary movement will be communicated to the Parties through the BCH?
Has your country established a mechanism for taking decisions on the import of LMOs-FFP?

Has your country declared through the BCH that in the absence of a regulatory framework its decisions prior to the first import of an LMO-FFP will be taken according to Article 11.6 of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?
Has your country indicated its needs for financial and technical assistance and capacity building in respect of LMOs-FFP?
Has your country ever taken a decision on LMOs-FFP (either on import or domestic use)?
How many LMOs-FFP has your country approved to date?
In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken regarding the import of LMOs-FFP?
In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs-FFP?
Has your country informed the Parties through the BCH of its decision(s) regarding import, of LMOs-FFP?
Has your country informed the Parties through the BCH of its decision(s) regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs-FFP within 15 days?

values.text: Yes, but with delays (i.e. longer than 15 days)

questions.text: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 11 in your country, including measures in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs-FFP:
Has your country established a mechanism for the review and change of a decision regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?
Has your country ever received a request for a review of a decision?
Has your country ever reviewed / changed a decision regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?
In the current reporting period, how many decisions were reviewed and/or changed regarding an intentional transboundary movement of an LMO?
Has your country informed the notifier and the BCH of the review and/or changes in the decision?

values.text: In some cases only the notifier
In some cases only the BCH

questions.text: Has your country informed the notifier and the BCH of the review and changes in the decision within thirty days?

values.text: Yes, but with delays (i.e. longer than 30 days)

questions.text: Has your country provided reasons to the notifier and the BCH for the review and/or changes in the decision?

values.text: In some cases only the notifier
In some cases only the BCH

questions.text: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 12 in your country:
Has your country established a system for the application of the simplified procedure regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?
Has your country ever applied the simplified procedure?
If you answered Yes to question 73, has your country informed the Parties through the BCH of the cases where the simplified procedure applies?
In the current reporting period, how many LMOs has your country applied the simplified procedure to?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 13 in your country:

text: Article 14 – Bilateral, regional and multilateral agreements and arrangements

questions.text: Has your country entered into any bilateral, regional or multilateral agreements or arrangements?
If you answered Yes to question 77, has your country informed the Parties through the BCH of the agreements or arrangements?
If you answered Yes to question 77, please provide a brief description of the scope and objective of the agreements or arrangements entered into:
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 14 in your country:
Has your country established a mechanism for conducting risk assessments prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
If you answered Yes to question 81, does this mechanism include procedures for identifying experts to conduct the risk assessments?
Has your country established guidelines for how to conduct risk assessments prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
Has your country acquired the necessary domestic capacity to conduct risk assessment?
Has your country established a mechanism for training national experts to conduct risk assessments?
Has your country ever conducted a risk assessment of an LMO for intentional introduction into the environment?
Has your country ever conducted a risk assessment of an LMO intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
If your country has taken decision(s) on LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment or on domestic use of LMOs-FFP, were risk assessments conducted for all decisions taken?
Has your country submitted summary reports of the risk assessments to the BCH?
In the current reporting period, if your country has taken decisions regarding LMOs, how many risk assessments were conducted in the context of these decisions?
Has your country ever required the exporter to conduct the risk assessment(s)?
Has your country ever required the notifier to bear the cost of the risk assessment(s) of LMOs?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 15 in your country:
Has your country established and maintained appropriate measures to prevent unintentional transboundary movements of LMOs?

Has your country taken measures to ensure that any LMO, whether imported or locally developed, undergoes an appropriate period of observation that is commensurate with its life-cycle or generation time before it is put to its intended use?
Has your country cooperated with other Parties with a view to identifying LMOs or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity?

Has your country cooperated with other Parties with a view to taking measures regarding the treatment of LMOs or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity?

Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 16 in your country, including any details regarding risk management strategies, also in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs:
LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
LMOs intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?

text: Article 17 – Unintentional transboundary movements and emergency measures

questions.text: Has your country made available to the BCH the relevant details setting out its point of contact for the purposes of receiving notifications under Article 17?

Has your country established a mechanism for addressing emergency measures in case of unintentional transboundary movements of LMOs that are likely to have significant adverse effect on biological diversity?
Has your country implemented emergency measures in response to information about releases that led, or may have led, to unintentional transboundary movements of LMOs?

In the current reporting period, how many times has your country received information concerning occurrences that led, or may have led, to unintentional transboundary movement(s) of one or more LMOs to or from territories under its jurisdiction?
Has your country notified affected or potentially affected States, the BCH and, where appropriate, relevant international organizations, of the above release?
If you answered Yes to question 104, who did your country notify?

values.text: The affected or potentially affected State

questions.text: Has your country immediately consulted the affected or potentially affected States to enable them to determine appropriate responses and initiate necessary action, including emergency measures?

values.text: No, consultation was made but not immediately

questions.text: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 17 in your country:

text: Article 18 – Handling, transport, packaging and identification

questions.text: Has your country taken measures to require that LMOs that are subject to transboundary movement are handled, packaged and transported under conditions of safety, taking into account relevant international rules and standards?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP clearly identifies that, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is not known through means such as identity preservation systems, they may contain living modified organisms and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP clearly identifies that, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is known through means such as identity preservation systems, they contain living modified organisms and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are destined for contained use clearly identifies them as living modified organisms and specifies any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information, including the name and address of the individual and institution to whom the LMO are consigned?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are intended for intentional introduction into the environment of the Party of import, clearly identifies them as living modified organisms; specifies the identity and relevant traits and/or characteristics, any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information and, as appropriate, the name and address of the importer and exporter; and contains a declaration that the movement is in conformity with the requirements of this Protocol applicable to the exporter?
Does your country have the capacity to enforce the requirements of identification and documentation of LMOs?
Has your country established procedures for the sampling and detection of LMOs?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 18 in your country:

text: Article 19 – Competent National Authorities and National Focal Points

questions.text: Has your country designated one national focal point for the Cartagena Protocol to be responsible for liaison with the Secretariat?
Has your country designated one national focal point for the Biosafety Clearing-House to liaise with the Secretariat regarding issues of relevance to the development and implementation of the BCH?

Has your country designated one or more competent national authorities, which are responsible for performing the administrative functions required by the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety and are authorized to act on your country’s behalf with respect to those functions?
In case your country designated more than one competent national authority, has your country conveyed to the Secretariat the respective responsibilities of those authorities?
Has your country made available the required information referred in questions 116-119 to the BCH?

In case your country has designated more than one competent national authority, has your country established a mechanism for the coordination of their actions prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
Has your country established adequate institutional capacity to enable the competent national authority(ies) to perform the administrative functions required by the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 19 in your country:

text: Article 20 – Information Sharing and the Biosafety Clearing-House (BCH)

questions.text: Has your country established a mechanism for strengthening the capacity of the BCH National Focal Point to perform its administrative functions?

Has your country established a mechanism for the coordination among the BCH National Focal Point, the Cartagena Protocol focal point, and the competent national authority(ies) for making information available to the BCH?
Does your country use the information available in the BCH in its decision making processes on LMOs?
Has your country experienced difficulties accessing or using the BCH?
If you answered Yes to question 128, has your country reported these problems to the BCH or the Secretariat?
Is the information submitted by your country to the BCH complete and up-to date?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 20 in your country:
Has your country established procedures to protect confidential information received under the Protocol?
Does your country allow the notifier to identify information that is to be treated as confidential?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 21 in your country:

Has your country received external support or benefited from collaborative activities with other Parties in the development and/or strengthening of human resources and institutional capacities in biosafety?
If you answered Yes to question 135, how were these resources made available?
Has your country provided support to other Parties in the development and/or strengthening of human resources and institutional capacities in biosafety?
If you answered Yes to question 137, how were these resources made available?
Is your country eligible to receive funding from the Global Environment Facility (GEF)?
Has your country ever initiated a process to access GEF funds for building capacity in biosafety?
If you answered Yes to question 140, how would you characterize the process?
Has your country ever received funding from the GEF for building capacity in biosafety?

values.text: Building Capacity for Effective Participation in the BCH (Phase I)
Building Capacity for Effective Participation in the BCH (Phase II)
Building Capacity for Effective Participation in the BCH (Phase III)

questions.text: During the current reporting period, has your country undertaken activities for the development and/or strengthening of human resources and institutional capacities in biosafety?
If you answered Yes to question 143, in which of the following areas were these activities undertaken?

values.text: Human resources capacity development and training
Risk assessment and other scientific and technical expertise
Public awareness, participation and education in biosafety
Information exchange and data management including participation in the Biosafety Clearing-House
Scientific, technical and institutional collaboration at subregional, regional and international levels
Identification of LMOs, including their detection
Implementation of the documentation requirements under Article 18.2 of the Protocol
Measures to address unintentional and/or illegal transboundary movements of LMOs
Scientific biosafety research relating to LMOs
Taking into account risks to human health

questions.text: During the current reporting period, has your country carried out a capacity-building needs assessment?
Does your country still have capacity-building needs?
If you answered Yes to question 146, indicate which of the following areas still need capacity-building.

values.text: Human resources capacity development and training
Risk assessment and other scientific and technical expertise
Public awareness, participation and education in biosafety
Information exchange and data management including participation in the Biosafety Clearing-House
Scientific, technical and institutional collaboration at subregional, regional and international levels
Identification of LMOs, including their detection
Implementation of the documentation requirements under Article 18.2 of the Protocol
Measures to address unintentional and/or illegal transboundary movements of LMOs
Scientific biosafety research relating to LMOs
Taking into account risks to human health

questions.text: Has your country developed a capacity-building strategy or action plan?
Has your country submitted the details of national biosafety experts to the Roster of Experts in the BCH?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 22 in your country, including further details about your experience in accessing GEF funds:

Has your country established a strategy or put in place legislation for promoting and facilitating public awareness, education and participation concerning the safe transfer, handling and use of LMOs?
Has your country established a biosafety website?
Has your country established a mechanism to ensure public access to information on living modified organisms that may be imported?
Has your country established a mechanism to consult the public in the decision-making process regarding LMOs?
Has your country established a mechanism to make available to the public the results of decisions taken on LMOs?
Has your country taken any initiative to inform its public about the means of public access to the Biosafety Clearing-House?
In the current reporting period, has your country promoted and facilitated public awareness, education and participation concerning the safe transfer, handling and use of LMOs?
If you answered Yes to question 157, has your country cooperated with other States and international bodies?
In the current reporting period, how many times has your country consulted the public in the decision-making process regarding LMOs and made the results of such decisions available to the public?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 23 in your country:
Has your country entered into any bilateral, regional, or multilateral agreement with non-Parties regarding transboundary movements of LMOs?
Has your country ever imported LMOs from a non-Party?
Has your country ever exported LMOs to a non-Party?
If you answered Yes to questions 162 or 163, were the transboundary movements of LMOs consistent with the objective of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?
If you answered Yes to questions 162 or 163, was information about these transboundary movements submitted to the BCH?
If your country is not a Party to the Cartagena Protocol, has it contributed information to the BCH on LMOs released in, or moved into, or out of, areas within its national jurisdiction?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 24 in your country:
Has your country adopted domestic measures aimed at preventing and/or penalizing transboundary movements of LMOs carried out in contravention of its domestic measures to implement this Protocol?
Has your country established a strategy for detecting illegal transboundary movements of LMOs?
In the current reporting period, how many times has your country received information concerning cases of illegal transboundary movements of an LMO to or from territories under its jurisdiction?
Has your country informed the BCH and the other Party(ies) involved?
Has your country established the origin of the LMO(s)?
Has your country established the nature of the LMO(s)?
Has your country established the circumstances of the illegal transboundary movement(s)?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 25 in your country:

If your country has taken a decision on import, has it ever taken into account socio-economic considerations arising from the impact of the LMO on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity?
Has your country cooperated with other Parties on research and information exchange on any socio-economic impacts of LMOs?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 26 in your country:
Has your country signed the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress?
Has your country initiated steps towards ratification, acceptance or approval of the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol?
Here you may provide further details on any activities undertaken in your country towards the implementation of the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress:
Has your country submitted the previous national reports (Interim and First National Reports)?
If your country did not submit previous reports, indicate the main challenges that hindered the submission

values.text: Lack of financial resources to gather the necessary information
Lack of relevant information at the national level
Difficulty in compiling the information from various sectors
No obligation to submit (e.g. country was not a Party at the time)

questions.text: Please use this field to provide any other information on issues related to national implementation of the Protocol, including any obstacles or impediments encountered.
Please use this field to provide any other information on difficulties that you have encountered in filling in this report.
